CLOUDEYES

Monitor your web services
from the cloud.

CloudEyes is an open-source application that runs in the cloud and constantly monitors your websites, alerting you immediately when a host becomes unreachable or a web page changes unexpectedly.

At the moment CloudEyes is not a service but rather a distributed application that you will have to deploy yourself to any PaaS or any server that can run Node.js.

CloudEyes is still under development, but the current version is already fully functional although at the moment it requires a few manual steps to set it up in the cloud.

Show me the code!

All the source code is available on Github.

In the repository you will also find an extensive description of how CloudEyes works, what is the idea behind it and some instructions and tips to deploy it yourself.

Also, feel free to collaborate! Fork the repository, make your changes and submit a pull request.
